title: Serre's inequality on height
summary: In algebra, specifically in the theory of commutative rings, Serre's inequality on height states: given a (Noetherian) regular ring A and a pair of prime ideals p , q {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {p}},{\mathfrak {q}}} in it, for each prime ideal r {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {r}}} that is a minimal prime ideal over the sum p + q {\displaystyle {\mathfrak {p}}+{\mathfrak {q}}} , the following inequality on heights holds:[1][2]
